titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to Miscellaneous Financial Materials Concerning Copper and Aluminum Mining Companies Operating in the North American West
Miscellaneous Financial Materials Concerning Copper and Aluminum Mining Companies Operating in the North American West
titlestmt.author: by Ellen Ellickson and Caroline Wilcox Reul

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 04:36

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous financial materials concerning copper and aluminum mining companies operating in the North American West

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: This collection, compiled by William H. Brown, contains a variety of financial documents concerning copper and aluminum mining companies operating in the North American West. Examples of these documents include company correspondence, employee retirement plans, letters and notices to the stockholders, prospectuses, lists detailing the transfer of stock and cash, reports, deposit agreements, notices of redemption, statements, company descriptions and newsletters, informational pamphlets, profiles of company executives, reprints of newspaper articles, maps, employee retirement plans, subscription agreements, underwriting agreements, co-operative deposit agreements, balance sheets, trust agreements, mortgage indentures, and reorganization and readjustment plans and agreements. While all of these documents are represented in the collection, they are not all represented by each company.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Most of these financial materials were part of a collection acquired by Yale in 1922 from William H. Brown of West Haven, Conn. The collection, initially called the William H. Brown Statistical Library, numbered some 23,000 documents and covered the years 1890 to 1917. The collection was merged with similar materials already in the University Library and later expanded by gifts from Brown and others to become what is now known as the William H. Brown Collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection, compiled by William H. Brown, contains a variety of financial documents concerning copper and aluminum mining companies operating in the North American West. Examples of these documents include company correspondence, employee retirement plans, letters and notices to the stockholders, prospectuses, lists detailing the transfer of stock and cash, reports, deposit agreements, notices of redemption, statements, company descriptions and newsletters, informational pamphlets, profiles of company executives, reprints of newspaper articles, maps, employee retirement plans, subscription agreements, underwriting agreements, co-operative deposit agreements, balance sheets, trust agreements, mortgage indentures, and reorganization and readjustment plans and agreements. While all of these documents are represented in the collection, they are not all represented by each company.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files are arranged first by region, i.e. Canada and the United States, and then alphabetically by company name.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Included are documents from the Utah Copper Company.

did.unittitle: Ohio and Arizona Copper Mining and Smelting Company

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Included is an 11-page report giving a detailed description of the mine including maps of the area.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Included is a detailed report of the mine property including maps, diagrams and reprinted newspaper articles.
